Xherdan Shaqiri will make his Liverpool debut in the second half of this evening’s International Champions Cup tie with Manchester United, Jürgen Klopp has confirmed.

Via @LFC

Klopp: “Yes, for sure. He will play in the second half, we will see how long, but he will play for sure.”

Klopp on Salah/Mané: “The next step for them is to play more minutes, of course. We will see how long. It’s good for us, so hopefully they can use the longer match time today to get fitter & fitter & fitter because in two weeks we start already. That’s what we’re working for.”

Klopp on goalkeepers: “They are very young, but as we’ve seen already they are really in a good moment and it’s very exciting for both of them to play tonight. They look pretty cool, but I can imagine inside, in front of 100,000, it’s something pretty special for them.”
